org.coniks.coniks_test_client

Class ConsistencyErr

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.coniks.coniks_test_client.ConsistencyErr

  • public final class ConsistencyErr
extends java.lang.Object
    Defines constants representing the types of errors that can occur during CONIKS consistency checks done by a client.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int BAD_MAPPING_ERR
      Indicates that the name-to-key mapping sent by the server is inconsistent with the root hash.
      static int BAD_SERVER_SIG_ERR
      Indicates that the server's signature is invalid.
      static int BAD_SIGNED_CHANGE_ERR
      Indicates that the signature on a signed key or user info change is invalid.
      static int BAD_STR_ERR
      Indicates that an STR is inconsistent with the Merkle tree root to which it is being compared.
      static int CHECK_PASSED
      Indicates that no error occurred during the consistency check.
      static int DISALLOWED_OP_ERR
      Indicates the the client has attempted to do a disallowed operation.
      static int EQUIVOCATION_ERR
      Indicates that an STR is inconsistent with another STR for the same epoch and key server.
      static int KEYSTORE_ERR
      Indicates an error occurred while trying to load or save a client's key pair.
      static int UNEXPECTED_KEY_ERR
      Indicates an unexpected key for a known name-to-key mapping.

    • Method Summary

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Field Detail

      • CHECK_PASSED

        public static final int CHECK_PASSED
        Indicates that no error occurred during the consistency check. In other words, the check passed.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • BAD_MAPPING_ERR

        public static final int BAD_MAPPING_ERR
        Indicates that the name-to-key mapping sent by the server is inconsistent with the root hash.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • UNEXPECTED_KEY_ERR

        public static final int UNEXPECTED_KEY_ERR
        Indicates an unexpected key for a known name-to-key mapping.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • BAD_STR_ERR

        public static final int BAD_STR_ERR
        Indicates that an STR is inconsistent with the Merkle tree root to which it is being compared.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • EQUIVOCATION_ERR

        public static final int EQUIVOCATION_ERR
        Indicates that an STR is inconsistent with another STR for the same epoch and key server. In other words, the key server has equivocated showing different parties diverging views of its key directory.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • BAD_SERVER_SIG_ERR

        public static final int BAD_SERVER_SIG_ERR
        Indicates that the server's signature is invalid.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • BAD_SIGNED_CHANGE_ERR

        public static final int BAD_SIGNED_CHANGE_ERR
        Indicates that the signature on a signed key or user info change is invalid.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • KEYSTORE_ERR

        public static final int KEYSTORE_ERR
        Indicates an error occurred while trying to load or save a client's key pair.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • DISALLOWED_OP_ERR

        public static final int DISALLOWED_OP_ERR
        Indicates the the client has attempted to do a disallowed operation. E.g. perform an unsigned key change when the user doesn't allow this.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values
